references.paper_title: Marginal structural models versus structural nested models as tools for causal inference
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the methodology used in this paper, providing the core theoretical justification for marginal structural models (MSMs) and their application in causal inference.

This book is a comprehensive guide to causal inference, covering many of the concepts and methods used in this paper, including those related to causal effects and the estimation of treatment effects in longitudinal studies.

references.paper_title: Causal inference in longitudinal studies with history-restricted marginal structural models
references.reason: This paper introduces history-restricted marginal structural models (HR-MSMs), which are specifically used in this paper to analyze sequential excursion effects.

references.paper_title: Assessing time-varying causal effect moderation in mobile health
references.reason: This paper extends the use of HR-MSMs to the analysis of time-varying causal effects, which is crucial for analyzing the sequential effects of optogenetic stimulation.

references.paper_title: Estimating time-varying causal excursion effects in mobile health with binary outcomes
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of causal excursion effects, a key element of the methodology in this paper for analyzing the short-term causal effects of treatment sequences.
